node.title: 'He picked up the basket and threw it with the baby still in it': Inquest hears of alleged past abuse
node.alt: A man attempts to cover his face with a book binder.
node.description: An inquest into the disappearance of Darlene Geertsema more than 40 years ago hears harrowing allegations about her then-boyfriend's behaviour â€” which included claims he threw a basket, with a baby in it, out a door.
node.content:
["The former partner of a Tasmanian woman who disappeared over 40 years ago\u00a0has denied\u00a0killing her and disposing of her body \u2014 but admitted he had been violent with her and another ex-wife.", "Darlene Avis Geertsema, then 30, was last seen at her home on Best Street in Devonport on the state's north-west coast in October, 1978.\u00a0", "Her body has never been found.\u00a0", "Ms Geertsema's partner at the time, John Shepherd, has been named as a \"person of interest\"\u00a0in her disappearance but no charges have been laid.\u00a0", "Mr Shepherd told a coronial inquest\u00a0in Launceston on Wednesday, Ms\u00a0Geertsema told him she was going to visit a friend who had been unwell, but\u00a0failed to return home.\u00a0", "Counsel assisting the coroner Madeleine Wilson SC put it to Mr Shepherd that he was \"the last person to see Darlene Geertsema alive and the first person to see her dead\", which he\u00a0denied.\u00a0", "", "
Darlene Geertsema, left, disappeared from Devonport in 1978.(Supplied: Tasmania Police)
", "Ms Wilson then suggested\u00a0that Ms Geertsema planned to end the relationship\u00a0and was planning to leave the state with the children.\u00a0", "The court heard that on the night of her disappearance, Ms Geertsema told Mr Shepherd she was pregnant and had cancer.", "Ms Wilson suggested Mr Shepherd was concerned because he knew he was not the father of the unborn child as she was in a relationship with another man at the time.\u00a0", "She then alleged Mr Shepherd \"delivered blows that caused her death\" before putting her body in the boot of a car.\u00a0", "
'I wasn't involved in her death'\u00a0
", "Mr Shepherd told the court when Ms Geertsema failed to return home he spent the next day driving around looking for her car, reported her missing to the police, and was \"pretty upset.\"\u00a0", "Coroner Simon Cooper quizzed Mr Shepherd on why, when Ms Geertsema had left three or four other times without telling him where she was going and on those occasions, he had not contacted\u00a0police.\u00a0", "\u201cBecause she'd left the kids with me. It's strange she'd leave them [the children]\u00a0like that.\"", "
Allegations of 'beatings, abuse'
", "On the first day of the inquest, Ms Geertsema's younger sister Dawn Bishop alleged on one occasion her\u00a0sister fled her home in the Launceston suburb of Trevallyn because Mr Shepherd had abused her.", "She told the court\u00a0Ms Geertsma's face was bruised and swollen and there was blood in \"the whites of her eyes\".", "", "
Ms Geertsema's car, a 1977 red Holden Sunbird, was found the day after she disappeared.\u00a0(Supplied: Tasmania Police)
", "When\u00a0Ms Bishop went to her sister's home to collect some of her\u00a0belongings, she told the inquest she saw\u00a0blood on the walls and the bed.\u00a0", "Mr Shepherd denied the allegation, saying he had argued with Ms Geertsema because she wanted to go to a party and when she locked him out of the property\u00a0\"she flashed her tits at me\".\u00a0", "He said the blood had come from a cut he got on his hand when he tried to get back into the house.", "In cross-examination, Ms Wilson put it to Mr Shepherd\u00a0the story was a fabrication\u00a0and it was the\u00a0assault on Ms Geertsema that led to the blood on the walls and bed.", "Mr Shepherd again denied it, but agreed he had assaulted Ms Geertsema on one occasion and \"it was just a backhand\" which caused a black eye.\u00a0", "
'I belted her \u2026 a couple of times'
", "In evidence to the inquest earlier on Wednesday Mr Shepherd's ex-wife, Wendy Shepherd told the court there was \"domestic violence\" in their relationship and that \"John would hit me.\"", "\"It was mostly when he wanted sex and I wouldn't comply,\" she said.", "\"He'd push me, he'd hit me, shout at me.\"\u00a0", "Ms Shepherd started crying as she told the court about an alleged incident involving the couple's baby who was lying in a bassinet.\u00a0", "Ms Shepherd said the baby was screaming and she was only allowed to go to her child after she had sex with Mr Shepherd.\u00a0", "When asked about the alleged incident, Mr Shepherd told the court: \"Definitely bloody not, no way I'd throw a child\".\u00a0", "Ms Shepherd then described another incident where she alleged\u00a0Mr Shepherd had beaten her.", "\"I had a fractured jaw, and I couldn't breathe properly because I had fractured ribs\".", "Ms Shepherd said she left the relationship after that\u00a0and sought legal aid to obtain a restraining order against Mr Shepherd.", "In his evidence, Mr Shepherd said he had hit Ms Shepherd about three times\u00a0because he was told that she was having sexual relations with other men.\u00a0", "The coroner's court also heard evidence from Mr Shepherd's current wife of 39 years, Marlene Shepherd who said her husband has pushed and shoved her in the past.\u00a0", "Mr Shepherd was formally released from bail and the court was adjourned for the Coroner Simon Cooper to determine his findings."]
